name: AC Hotel Malaga Palacio by Marriott

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On arrival at the hotel we were not sure where to park the car. There is a waiting area just out front and you can deposit the car there for 15 mins max before it has to move. We elected to have the porter park the car as the one way system and no parking around the cathedral makes finding spaces awkward. Check-in was easy and the reception staff very pleasant and efficient. Stayed in the hotel for a couple of nights and had a room outside the elevator on the top floor. Always wary about rooms located in such places but it was not too bad and the view out over the promenade was lovely. We did not go for breakfast as the other half doesn't and there are plenty of places around for coffee etc. The room was lovely and clean with a wooden floor and felt spacious, think it might have been recently renovated. The free soft drinks was a nice touch, especially when you . We were really surprised by the prices for drinks in the hotel, they were cheap in comparison to those you find in a lot of good hotels these days. Would recommend you go upstairs to the top floor if you get a chance to look over the city you will get one of the best views over the Cathedral and the city.
reviews.title: Very central

reviews.text: I witnessed the accident on the hotel steps mentioned by lamb04. Certianly the hotel management knew all about it, because the next morning they helped to find a pharmacy, and sent a taxi to buy some crutches for the victim, and helped with phone calls to the insurance company. I am surprised there is no report of it in the hotel books, as by the next day all the staff knew of the fall, and how it happened. Be careful on a Saturday night; as you wont get much attention from the hotel staff. Yes, you can leave your cases in the street, and walk up the stairs and ask for help. Er, isnt there a thing called a porter? Especially in a five star hotel? Otherwise the hotel was good, though the cafeteria was shut for repairs. However, there were lots of good cafes nearby for breakfast. You had to buy a card (12 euros) to have wifi in the room, and the card didnt work; however, the hotel reimbursed me for the card.
reviews.title: confirm accident on steps story

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Palacio is a great hotel with many nuances. The most obvious to the stingy British tourist is the free minibar, which we have enjoyed consuming in its entirely on several occasions now; our only only disappointment is that only one of the drinks is alcoholic though the fridge is large enough to accommodate one's own gin and tonic! The bedrooms are large and the bed is easily rotated; this is a great feature since rotating the beds by 90 degrees afford an excellent view out of the hotel window, though as the sun hits the hotel directly in the morning it's important to ensure that any foodstuffs are removed from the sun's harmful rays. The bathroom is a superb feature and the bath can easily accommodate two with some high quality toiletries to relax with therein. We were particularly fond of the AC Palacio slippers which are in a sealed pack and therefore clearly intended to be removed for your future use.
reviews.title: A great place to stay for an exciting time in Malaga!

reviews.text: Service at the hotel is excellent; the room service waiter was calm and collected as he delivered a sumptuous platter of Iberico ham and Manchego cheese on a silver tray despite some obvious distractions. On our second visit we found our initial room unsatisfactory...the charming front desk receptionist attended to us personally and escorted us to a much more acceptable room without quibble.
reviews.title: Repeat visit for the location and hotel experience...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The balconies are a great feature; they are large enough to relax on and even sleep on if the weather is clement. We found the size just right for our needs as we relaxed in the Malaga sunshine the following morning and enjoyed ourselves in total seclusion. One disappointment was the MP3 player which despite numerous attempts we could not get to work owing to confusion despite both of us being highly adept with electronic devices.
reviews.title: over heated and over rated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We only stayed one night. The hotel isn’t new but well-maintained. The location is excellent near the cathedral in the city center and from our room a lovely harbor view. From the airport you can take bus line A to a bus stop right outside the hotel. The room had a balcony, a spacious double bed, Wi-Fi, free minibar and a big well-equipped bathroom. Coffee/tea facilities and a safe-box in the room would be a good improvement.
reviews.title: Central and pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don’t choose the hotel for the breakfast. It’s of average quality and overpriced.
reviews.title: Excellent location for sightseeing, average hotel

reviews.text: The staff is helpful and speaks fluently English.
reviews.title: Ideally situated

reviews.text: The breakfast, missing coffee/tea facilities and safe-box in the room is why I end on 4 stars instead of 5.
reviews.title: Excellent location, good value for money

reviews.text: This hotel was located right next to the Cathedral and all the tourist sights and public transport links. There was a rooftop bar with great views and a swimming pool which unfortunately sounds better and looks better in the photos than in person! It wasn't private enough and so we didn't use it during our stay. The room was average. It was clean enough but the pictures on the wall were torn and faded and had no association with the city. Perhaps a Picasso print would have been more appropriate. I would however recommend for the location alone.
reviews.title: Nice place to spend a night or two

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location - Good location in centre of Malaga close to shopping and old town area. Close to bus stop for Airport express bus, 5 mins walk to local train station that connects Malaga to Fuengirola, 15 min walk to main railway and bus stations, these can be accessed via. local train line one stop along.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: Reception/Check in - 6 steep stairs at entry, but the man on the door did offer to carry case up these stairs, probably in response to previous review. The reception area is small in proportion to the hotel and when we arrived one person was giving a media interview 6 young people were waiting at the top of the stairs 2 couples were checking in and it was bordering on the chaotic, would not like to see it when it is busy. The rest of the ground floor, lounge library was spacious.
reviews.title: Best location

reviews.text: There are 3 main lifts and a further one in a side room/area not sure where that one goes, the main lifts are small and you would be lucky to fit 3 in with luggage. They also seemed to be stuck on the top floor, which I brought to the attention of the reception one evening without any real resolution. I am of the opinion are for some reason at least one lift was being held on the top floor almost permanently. Anyway I do not like having to wait 5 mins for a lift and having it stop every floor as the other lifts are not effectively in use.
reviews.title: Very lovely hotel, but expensive
Nice hotel, nice location
reviews.text: Room - we had a standard double with balcony on 3rd floor, room was nice as was bathroom boutique style, the bed was comfortable and the mini bar was complimentary. The balcony was a reasonable size, but no seats on it. I was expecting some road noise, but it was more than that the traffic noise, horns people shouting was very loud, and at 6.30am on our final morning I could hear the noise of the horses shoes pulling one of the carriages that take tourists around Malaga, clearly getting best position for the main day of Easter celebrations. If you can hear that the double glazing is clearly inadequate.

Other facilities - fitness room on 3rd floor reasonable, has some machines, loose dumbells and extra water in fridge when training. roof terrace has cafe/bar some seats and a small plunge pool, but has excellent views of Malaga.
reviews.title: STAFF NOT FRIENDLY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has a great location,harbor views, 3 block walk to Picasso's Museum, great shopping, great food!
reviews.title: Very nice location but a little noise

reviews.text: If you get a room on the harbor side go when they turn on the airconditioning or if you open the window it get very noise. Service top notch.
reviews.title: Great location, fantastic view from top floor restaurant/terras but room was not clean and restaurant was not ready to service g

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location of hotel was great. Next to the main points of interest. Sea side view from room (611) was very nice. First night the floor of the room was dirty as we were getting very black feet. Staff cleaned it very well after our the remark.
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast selection very good. Included fresh fruit.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: Good service parking our car.
reviews.title: Great Location - a short walk to old city and shops
